meanings.definition: To inform on someone to the authorities.
meanings.sent1: I saw him ratten on his friend to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: She decided to ratten on the bullies to the principal.
meanings.sent3: The little bird ratted on its siblings for eating all the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The spy ratted on his own team, revealing their secret plans.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog would never ratten on its owner, no matter what.

meanings.sent1: The rain started to ratten the paper, making the ink run.
meanings.sent2: Please don't ratten the surprise by telling her early.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to ratten the yarn ball, unraveling it completely.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds began to ratten the old wooden fence.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays can slowly ratten the color of fabric left outside.

meanings.definition: A person who informs on others.
meanings.sent1: The ratten in the group always told the teacher about any rule-breaking.
meanings.sent2: Nobody wanted to be friends with the class ratten.
meanings.sent3: The little sister earned the nickname 'family ratten' for always revealing secrets.
meanings.sent4: The workplace ratten caused tension among colleagues with constant reports.
meanings.sent5: The village ratten was known for gossiping and spreading rumors.
